author: ryanleeschneider
content:
> need some way to do deposits that mint eth

Hmm, what about using EIP-4895 withdrawals?  (basically each bridge transfer for end up as a `withdrawal` after being validated by the CL).

Anyways sounds like I need to look at the OP stack, I didn't realize it uses the engine API, and this is the 2nd time in 24h someone has directed me towards that diff link. :). Thanks for the pointer!

author: ajsutton
content:
Yeah withdrawals would provide the ability to mint so maybe there could be some simplification from that. The other part of deposits is that they can be a full tx (call contracts etc) which is important for censorship resistance and the gas for them is paid on L1. Might still be workable to have a withdrawal for just the right amount and a normal tx included in the block. 
There are some other details that require modifications currently (like the CL being able to force inclusion of transactions).

author: ajsutton
content: We could make the engine api more generally applicable for L2 and things like system transactions and PBS anti censorship approaches sometimes line up quite well with what an L2 would need. But I doubt we’d ever get to using a completely standard execution client just because it wouldn’t be a priority for L1 dev.
